markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Lucky Kitchen Witch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1710)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 77</row>

**Price** 250 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This small doll in the shape of a witch is made from sticks and clad in a simple dress, bonnet, and wooden shoes. It sits astride a miniature straw broom. When hung in a kitchen, the witch brings good luck and protects a cook from malicious spirits. The _lucky kitchen witch_ must hang in a kitchen for a week to give any benefit.

 When you have a _lucky kitchen witch_ hung in your kitchen, you can reroll a [Cooking Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) or [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) check made during downtime to make food, [Earn Income](/Actions.aspx?ID=23), or [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) an [alchemical](/Traits.aspx?ID=6) item in your kitchen.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Lucky Kitchen Witch
